args.natural_language_statement: Every map of sets f : S → G to a group extends uniquely to a morphism of groups f : ⟨S⟩ → G from the free group on the set S, mapping each s ∈ S to f(s). In Lean/Mathlib4 terms: for types S and group G, FreeGroup.lift gives an equivalence (S → G) ≃ (FreeGroup S →* G). State that for any f : S → G there exists a unique φ : FreeGroup S →* G with φ (FreeGroup.of s) = f s for all s, and equivalently φ = FreeGroup.lift f. End the statement with := by sorry.

result:
{"ok": true, "lean_translation": "import Mathlib
open Function Set

/-- Every map of sets f : S → G to a group extends uniquely to a morphism of groups f : ⟨S⟩ → G from the free group on the set S, mapping each s ∈ S to f(s). In Lean/Mathlib4 terms: for types S and group G, FreeGroup.lift gives an equivalence (S → G) ≃ (FreeGroup S →* G). State that for any f : S → G there exists a unique φ : FreeGroup S →* G with φ (FreeGroup.of s) = f s for all s, and equivalently φ = FreeGroup.lift f. End

args.content:
import Mathlib

/-- Every map f : S → G to a group extends uniquely to a group hom φ : FreeGroup S →* G
    with φ (FreeGroup.of s) = f s for all s. -/
theorem free_group_extend_unique {S : Type _} {G : Type _} [Group G] (f : S → G) :
  ∃! φ : FreeGroup S →* G, ∀ s : S, φ (FreeGroup.of s) = f s := by sorry
